subject: Re: [junit] Re: Finding all the tests for a class?
msgSnippet: ... I never suggested packages, Cedric. Separate source trees. Have you been thinking I was suggesting moving tests into different /packages/ all this time? I
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 11/30/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > This may not be the big problem you think it is.
> >
> > A four+ hour nightly build isn't really a problem - there is no-one in
> > the office. The problem is that you lack fast feedback during the day.
> >
> > If you can come up with a day-time build that takes less time (e.g. by
> > seperating tests into fast vs slow), you can then focus on getting the
> > coverage of this build to a point where you are confident that if it
> > passes, the nightly build will pass.
>
>
> Test groups to the rescue!
>
> So are you going to suggest to create packages "com.foo.fast" and "
> com.foo.slow" to simulate groups? :-)

I never suggested packages, Cedric. Separate source trees.

Have you been thinking I was suggesting moving tests into different
/packages/ all this time? I would never do something so stupid.
